rule_text: Any welder who is required to do additional testing by the Employer, shall be paid for weld time of four (4) hours per successful test
reasoning: Establishes a fixed payment of 4 hours for a successful standard welding test.

rule_text: excluding the boiler ¼ Down Hand Plate or other single ¼ plate test, will be paid two (2) hours
reasoning: Establishes a reduced fixed payment of 2 hours for specific simpler welding tests.

rule_text: Additional test consists of three plates welded in the vertical, horizontal and overhead positions and will be paid a maximum of four (4) hours total, upon successful completion.
reasoning: Sets a maximum cap of 4 hours pay for a combined multi-position test.

rule_text: Those requested to take an abbreviated version of the plate test will be compensated at one and a half (1.5) hours for each successful plate test.
reasoning: Establishes specific compensation for abbreviated plate tests.

rule_text: In any event a welder will not be paid for a failed test.
reasoning: Explicit exclusion of payment for failed tests.

rule_text: If a welder is required to test at the job site, the welder shall be paid for any applicable travel allowance
reasoning: Entitles welders to travel allowance for on-site testing.

rule_text: If an Employer is requesting more than three (3) tests per welder and a welder has successfully completed three (3) of four (4) tests, the Employer may retain the welder and pay for the three (3) successful weld test. If the Employer decides not to retain the welder, he or she will be paid for the three (3) successful weld tests.
reasoning: Guarantees payment for successful tests when multiple tests are requested, regardless of hiring decision.

rule_text: Should a secondary test be required by the Employer, the employee shall be paid for the time required to take such a test.
reasoning: Ensures payment for actual time worked during secondary testing.

rule_text: Any welder... instructed to proceed to take tests, necessitating their having to travel outside of the city limits... shall be reimbursed in an amount necessary to compensate them for travel allowance, transportation, travel expenses, subsistence allowance, if applicable.
reasoning: Provides reimbursement for travel and subsistence when testing requires travel outside city limits.

rule_text: Any welder who successfully completes the welding test, but fails to report for work as notified, without a bona fide reason acceptable to the Employer, will not be eligible for any payment, including testing time and other allowances
reasoning: Clawback rule: forfeits all payments (time and allowances) if the welder does not report for work after passing.

rule_text: Alloy welders with a valid alloy welding certificate will be paid an additional premium of three dollars and twenty-five cents ($3.25) per hour worked if certification was a requirement for dispatch.
reasoning: Establishes a specific hourly wage premium for certified alloy welders.

rule_text: This premium shall not pyramid on an overtime hour; however, it will attract applicable Vacation and Statutory Holiday Pay.
reasoning: Defines calculation rules for the alloy premium regarding overtime multiplication and holiday pay accrual.

rule_text: The normal hours of work shall be between the hours of 7:00 a.m. and 6:00 p.m. for an eight (8) hour day with one-half (½) or one (1) hour for lunch at the midpoint of the shift. Forty (40) hours shall constitute a normal week's work, Monday through Friday inclusive.
reasoning: Defines the standard billing parameters for straight time (normal hours, days, and weekly caps).

rule_text: If the foregoing starting or quitting times are changed without mutual agreement, applicable overtime rates shall be paid for any time worked before or after the above hours as a result of the change of times.
reasoning: Establishes an overtime trigger for schedule changes not mutually agreed upon.

rule_text: Work performed on a make-up day shall be paid at the regular straight time rate for the first ten (10) hours to a maximum of forty (40) hours per week, after which double time (2X) rates shall apply.
reasoning: Specific billing rule for 'make-up days' (weather delays), defining straight time caps and double time triggers.

rule_text: Where a holiday occurs during the normal work week the maximum of thirty (30) hours per week shall form the basis of maximum straight time rate.
reasoning: Adjusts the weekly straight-time cap when a holiday occurs in the schedule.

rule_text: Work performed on Saturday, Sunday, or Recognized Holidays shall be paid at the applicable overtime premium.
reasoning: Explicitly categorizes all weekend and holiday work as overtime.

rule_text: If this break falls outside the regular lunch break established on the job, they shall receive an additional allowance of one-half (½) hour of pay at straight time rates which shall be in addition to their regular straight time hours.
reasoning: Defines a financial penalty/allowance paid to the employee for displaced lunch breaks.

rule_text: If overtime is to follow the regular eight (8) hour work shift, a further ten (10) minute rest or coffee break shall be established before commencing overtime.
reasoning: Mandates an additional paid break specifically triggered by the transition to overtime.

rule_text: When working ten (10) hour shifts, in lieu of the work breaks and lunch breaks provided herein, the Employer shall have the option of scheduling two (2) breaks of one-half (½) hour each, both paid at the applicable rate
reasoning: Provides an alternative billing/schedule structure for 10-hour shifts where breaks are paid time.

rule_text: For the purpose of clarification and to define Saturday and Sunday work, the work shall be deemed to commence at the starting time of the regular day shift on Monday morning.
reasoning: Defines the start of the work week for calculating weekend work.

rule_text: Shifts may be commenced on any calendar day provided the appropriate requirements for shift premium and overtime as specified in this Agreement are met.
reasoning: Establishes the flexibility to start shifts on any day subject to premium/overtime rules.

rule_text: For the purpose of defining the shifts, the 1st shift shall be the day shift which commences at 7:00 a.m. This starting time may be varied by mutual agreement to suit job requirements.
reasoning: Defines the standard start time for the first shift and the mechanism to vary it.

rule_text: Second (2 nd ) and third (3 rd ) shifts shall commence not later than one (1) hour after the completion of the preceding shift, except where this is prevented by conditions or requirements beyond the control of the Employer.
reasoning: Sets the maximum time gap allowed between consecutive shifts.

rule_text: A shift premium shall apply on all hours worked on second (2 nd ) and third (3 rd ) shifts at the rates as set out in the Wage and Benefit Schedule.
reasoning: Establishes the entitlement to a premium for 2nd and 3rd shifts.

rule_text: All shift premium hours will be paid at a rate of four dollars and fifty cents ($4.50) per hour.
reasoning: Specifies the exact monetary rate for the shift premium.

rule_text: When an employee is required to return to work without an eight (8) hour break, all work performed shall be paid for at the applicable overtime rates, until such time as the employee receives an eight (8) hour break.
reasoning: Defines overtime entitlement triggered by insufficient rest breaks between shifts.

rule_text: No such changes will be implemented without the mutual consent of both parties.
reasoning: Requirement for mutual consent regarding flexibility/changes to shift schedules.

rule_text: When an employee is required to work in excess of the regular hours, Monday through Friday inclusive, they shall be paid overtime at the rate of time and one- half (1 ½) the regular rate of pay.
reasoning: Establishes the standard overtime rate (1.5x) for weekdays.

rule_text: Double (2) time will be paid after ten (10) hours worked.
reasoning: Establishes the double-time threshold based on daily hours worked.

rule_text: Employees working on a Saturday, Sunday, and Recognized Holidays shall be paid an overtime rate at double (2) time the regular rate of pay.
reasoning: Establishes the double-time rate for all hours worked on weekends and holidays.

rule_text: Employees working overtime shall continue to receive their shift premium for all hours worked. The shift premium shall not be compounded for overtime hours worked.
reasoning: Clarifies how shift premiums are applied during overtime hours.

rule_text: When an employee works beyond ten (10) hours per day, they shall be entitled to a meal break and meal supplied by the Company. The meal break will be provided after ten (10) hours of work and subsequent meal breaks each four (4) hours thereafter.
reasoning: Defines the threshold (10 hours) for receiving a meal and a break.

rule_text: All overtime meal breaks will be thirty (30) minutes in duration and will be paid for at straight time rates.
reasoning: Specifies the duration and payment rate for the overtime meal break itself.

rule_text: When such events occur, the Employer shall provide the employees: A) Scheduled Overtime ... I) a payment of thirty (30) minutes at the straight-time total package hourly rate in lieu of the meal break, and II) a fifteen (15) minute rest break at the applicable rate of pay.
reasoning: Defines compensation when a meal cannot be provided during scheduled overtime.

rule_text: B) Unscheduled Overtime ... I) a payment of forty dollars ($40.00) as a meal allowance. II) a payment of thirty (30) minutes at the straight-time total package hourly rate in the lieu of meal break, and III) a fifteen (15) minute rest break at the applicable rate of pay.
reasoning: Defines compensation ($40 + time) when a meal cannot be provided during unscheduled overtime.

rule_text: There shall be no meal allowance applicable to those receiving subsistence, however any reduction to the current subsistence rates will attract a meal allowance payment equivalent to the reduction.
reasoning: Excludes employees on subsistence from receiving the separate meal allowance.

rule_text: Where a camp is provided, employees will not receive the forty dollars ($40.00) meal allowance where they are able to receive a camp meal at the end of their shift.
reasoning: Excludes employees in camp from the $40 allowance if a meal is available.

rule_text: Employees will be on site a total of twelve (12) hours and paid for twelve (12) hours for all work days including overtime days.
reasoning: Specific rule for the optional 12-hour shift schedule regarding paid hours.

rule_text: The pay allowance as provided for in the appropriate Appendix shall be included in the employees' weekly pay. This pay allowance shall be in lieu of actual pay for any of the Recognized Holidays as specified herein.
reasoning: Defines the structure of holiday compensation as an allowance added to weekly pay rather than payment for the specific day off.

rule_text: This pay allowance shall be applied to gross wages for all hours earned including: overtime and shift premium; and also to waiting and reporting time per Article 15.00; daily travel allowance per Article 16.01.
reasoning: Specifies the basis for calculating the holiday pay allowance, explicitly including travel allowances and premiums.

reasoning: Establishes the pay rate (2.0x) for work performed on a recognized holiday.

rule_text: Should any of the above listed holidays (Article 14.02) occur on a Saturday or Sunday, such holiday shall be observed on the preceding Friday or on the following Monday unless changed by mutual agreement between the Employer and the Local Lodge Representative.
reasoning: Defines the default logic for observing holidays that fall on weekends.

rule_text: When the four (4) ten (10) hour day option is being worked and a Holiday falls during the normal work week the maximum of thirty (30) hours per week shall form the basis of maximum straight time.
reasoning: Adjusts the maximum straight-time hours for the week when a holiday occurs within a 4x10 schedule.

rule_text: When working the four (4) x ten (10) hour work week Monday to Thursday and the recognized holiday falls on the Friday it will be moved to the preceding Thursday. Thursday is the double time day and Friday is the time and one-half day.
reasoning: Specific scheduling and pay rate rule for Monday-Thursday crews when a holiday falls on a Friday.

rule_text: When working the four (4) x ten (10) hour work week Tuesday to Friday and the holiday falls on the Monday it is observed on the Tuesday.
reasoning: Specific scheduling rule for Tuesday-Friday crews when a holiday falls on a Monday.

rule_text: Employers will post the date to be observed no later than seven (7) days prior to the holiday.

rule_text: When an employee, on initial hire or transfer to a project, is instructed by the Employer to report to a job location on a certain day but is not placed to work until a later date, they shall be entitled to two (2) hours pay, plus subsistence if applicable, for each of the first two (2) regular working days they are kept waiting.
reasoning: Establishes a specific pay entitlement (2 hours) and subsistence entitlement for the first two days of waiting time upon hire or transfer.

rule_text: Thereafter the waiting pay shall be increased to a full day of pay (i.e. eight (8) hours) for each regular working day.
reasoning: Defines the pay entitlement (8 hours) for waiting time extending beyond the first two days.

rule_text: When an employee reports to work and cannot work because of inclement weather they shall be paid two (2) hours reporting time and the employee must remain on the job for the two (2) hour period, unless otherwise instructed by the Employer's supervisor.
reasoning: Sets the minimum reporting pay (2 hours) specifically for inclement weather scenarios.

rule_text: When an employee has commenced work and is instructed to stop due to inclement weather, they shall be paid for the actual time worked. In no case shall an employee receive less than two (2) hours of pay.
reasoning: Establishes a minimum 2-hour pay guarantee even if work stops early due to weather after starting.

rule_text: When an employee reports to work and is not given the opportunity to work because none is available or was not advised before the completion of the previous day of work, they shall be paid two (2) hours of reporting time
reasoning: Defines show-up/reporting pay (2 hours) when work is unavailable without prior notice.

rule_text: When an employee has started to work on their regular shift and is instructed to stop, they shall be paid for the actual time worked. In no case shall the employee receive less than two (2) hours of pay.
reasoning: General minimum pay guarantee (2 hours) for shifts started but stopped by the employer.

rule_text: If an employee stops work for reasons of their own, and without the approval of the Employer, they shall be entitled to pay only for the hours actually worked in the day and minimum conditions shall not apply.
reasoning: Excludes the employee from minimum pay guarantees if they stop work voluntarily.

rule_text: An employee who is affected by the Conditions set out above shall be entitled to subsistence in accordance with the provisions of this Agreement.
reasoning: Ensures that days spent waiting or reporting (even if sent home) still qualify for subsistence/LOA.

rule_text: When an employee qualifies for reporting or waiting time, such time shall include the regular shift premium when applicable.
reasoning: Clarifies that non-worked paid time (reporting/waiting) must include shift differentials/premiums.

rule_text: When an employee is notified eight (8) hours prior to the commencement of the scheduled starting time not to report for work, then such employee will not be entitled to any reporting time.
reasoning: Sets the deadline (8 hours prior) for the employer to cancel work without incurring reporting pay costs.

rule_text: If it is not a lost time accident covered by Workers' Compensation, they shall also be paid for the remaining unworked normal daily hours for that day (e.g. eight (8) hours, or in case of a compressed work day ten (10) hours) at the applicable rate.
reasoning: Guarantees full day pay for employees injured on the job if the injury prevents finishing the shift but isn't a WCB lost time claim.

rule_text: Should an employee residing in camp accommodation be requested by the Employer or the Clients' designated camp management personnel to move to another room or camp... the employee shall be paid two (2) hours at the applicable straight time rate to carry out the move, if done outside work hours.
reasoning: Provides a specific 2-hour payment for moving camp rooms outside of regular working hours.

rule_text: On those projects that are located between forty-five (45) radius kilometers to one hundred and twenty (120) radius kilometers from Edmonton and/or Calgary City Hall(s) or other Hiring Hall locations, the Employer shall supply suitable transportation to and from the project and mutually agreed to pick-up points.
reasoning: Defines the employer's obligation to provide transportation based on specific radial distances.

rule_text: Alternatively, the Employer shall pay to each employee a transportation cost at the rate of sixty-nine cents ($0.69) per road kilometer for each day worked or reported for work, from the edge of the forty-five (45) radius kilometer free zone to the project and return.
reasoning: Establishes a mileage reimbursement rate for daily travel when employer transportation is not used.

rule_text: Subsistence will be paid or camp provided on projects which are more than one hundred and twenty (120) radius kilometers from the City Hall(s) of Edmonton and Calgary or other Hiring Hall locations.
reasoning: Sets the distance threshold for when subsistence allowance or camp accommodation is required.

rule_text: Subsistence will be paid at a rate of one hundred and fifty dollars ($150.00) per day worked or reported for.
reasoning: Defines the standard monetary rate for daily subsistence allowance.

rule_text: On sites which are four hundred and seventy-five (475) radius kilometers plus as noted above, subsistence will be paid on a seven (7) day per week basis.
reasoning: Expands subsistence payment from 'days worked' to '7 days per week' based on extreme distance.

rule_text: employees not residing in the area where the project is located will be eligible to receive one additional day of subsistence for either the day before commencing work or the day after completing the work assignment, where the project is greater than two hundred (200) road kilometers from the City Hall(s) of Edmonton and Calgary, or other Hiring Hall locations.
reasoning: Provides for check-in/check-out subsistence payments for distant projects.

rule_text: Initial and Terminal travel for any project which falls within one- hundred (100) radius kilometers of Ft. McMurray city hall will be two hundred and ninety-seven dollars ($297.00).
reasoning: Specifies a fixed travel allowance rate for a specific geographic region (Ft. McMurray).

rule_text: No travel shall be payable under this Article if the Client provides transportation to the work site and return.
reasoning: Establishes an exclusion rule where employer-provided transport negates travel pay entitlement.

rule_text: Initial travel amounts will be paid after fifteen (15) calendar days on the job or at lay- off. Terminal travel will be paid at lay-off.
reasoning: Defines the vesting period and timing for paying out initial and terminal travel allowances.

rule_text: On a subsistence project, employees residing in the area where the project is located will not be eligible for Accommodation Allowance and initial/terminal travel but will receive daily travel payments pursuant to Article 16.01 (a) if they reside outside a forty-five (45) radius kilometer free zone around the project.
reasoning: Clarifies entitlements for local residents working on projects designated as subsistence projects.

rule_text: Should the Employer fail to comply with this provision (excluding the reference to the Record of Employment), the employee shall receive an additional sum equivalent to eight (8) hours of pay at straight time rates for each day they are kept waiting exclusive of Saturday, Sunday and Statutory Holidays up to a maximum of forty (40) hours of pay.

rule_text: If the Employer fails to comply with this requirement within five (5) working days after the specified pay day, the employee shall receive an additional sum equivalent to eight (8) hours of pay at straight time rates.

rule_text: For those employees with more than three (3) years of continuous service with one (1) Employer, the employee will be entitled to bereavement pay benefits of eight (8) hours multiplied by the employees' base wage rate for up to three (3) days of lost work incurred as a results of the employee's attendance at a funeral or memorial service upon the dea th of an employee's Spouse, Child, Parent, Parent -in-Law, Grandparent or Sibling.

rule_text: The parties to this Agreement agree that the maximum of nine (9) hours shall constitute a normal days work beginning at 7:30 a.m. and ending at 5:00 p.m. (excluding a one-half hour (1/2) lunch break) may be utilized if restricted to Long Term Base Crew employees.

rule_text: It is understood that when employees are hired with the intentions of short-term employment (defined as less than six (6) weeks from the date of hire) that they will be paid time and one-half (1 1/2) for the ninth (9th) hour.

rule_text: Overtime payments for work on the scheduled eighteen (18) days off will be at time and one half (1 ½) for the first twelve (12) hours and double-time (2) paid thereafter.

rule_text: Double-time (2) will be paid for all hours worked on Sundays and Statutory Holidays.

rule_text: If an employee is asked to work their scheduled flex day off without being given forty- eight (48) hours notice, then the employee will be paid overtime at time and one half (1 ½) for up to twelve (12) hours except on Sundays and Statutory Holidays where double-time (2) will be paid for all hours worked.

rule_text: If a long term employee is terminated without having a flex EDO within the previous six (6) weeks, then an adjustment will be made to pay any regular hours worked in excess of two hundred and forty (240) hours over the previous six (6) weeks at the applicable overtime rate.

rule_text: During a period of Plant Shutdown, all employees hired with the intentions of short- term employment shall be paid based on five (5) eight (8) hour days Monday to Friday or four (4) ten (10) hour days Monday to Thursday and or Tuesday to Friday.
reasoning: Sets the specific work schedule and payment basis for short-term employees during Plant Shutdowns.

rule_text: Those hired for the Plant Shutdown will continue to receive compensation under the terms of short term employment until the conclusion of the work even if they are on site longer than six (6) weeks.

rule_text: Overtime payments for work on the sixteen (16) scheduled EDO's will be paid at double (2x).

rule_text: In the event that the fourteen (14) day conditions are not met, pay conditions will be adjusted to pay eight (8) hours per day Monday through Friday at the straight time hourly rate, plus applicable shift premium, and all hours worked after the eight (8) hours per day, Monday through Friday and all hours worked on Saturday and Sunday at the applicable overtime rates.

rule_text: On the eight (8) hour day, all EDO's will be compensated as follows: The first two (2) hours worked at double-time (2x) The next four (4) hours worked at time and one half (1 ½x) The last two (2) hours at double-time (2x)
reasoning: Specifies overtime rates for working on Earned Days Off (EDOs) for 8-hour shifts.

rule_text: All hours worked on Statutory Holidays will be paid at double-time (2x) in accordance with Compressed Work Week rates.
reasoning: Defines the pay rate for working on Statutory Holidays under compressed work weeks.

rule_text: The shift premium on all compressed work week night shifts will be three dollars and fifty cents ($3.50) per hour for all straight time hours worked on shift.
reasoning: Sets the specific hourly shift premium for night shifts in a compressed work week.

rule_text: When working ten (10) hours with two (2) fifteen (15) minute paid breaks and a half (1/2) hour lunch, the midday lunch period of one-half (1/2) hour on workdays of ten (10) hours or less between the hours of 7:30 a.m. and 7:30 p.m. will be unpaid.

rule_text: In the case that any Journeyman, whose skill is welding, is required to take a customer requested welding test, the Employer agrees that such Journeyman will... be paid any applicable travel allowance.

rule_text: Provided that the Employee reports to test at the time scheduled by the Employer, they shall be paid one full day's pay if they pass the test, and the Employer has no work available for them on that day.
reasoning: Guarantees a full day's pay for passing a test if no other work is provided.

rule_text: if an Employee reports after the scheduled test time and passes the test they shall be paid from the time they started the test until the normal end of that shift.
reasoning: Defines payment calculation for employees who are late for the test but still pass.

rule_text: A welder who fails the test shall not be paid for the time required to complete the failed test but will be paid any applicable travel allowance.
reasoning: Denies payment for labor time upon failure, but explicitly grants travel allowance.

rule_text: In the event the worker is required to take multiple tests and passes some of the tests but fails others... will be paid for the time taken on successful tests if not hired.
reasoning: Specifies payment logic for mixed results in multiple test scenarios when not hired.

rule_text: Welders successfully completing such tests shall receive a regular day's pay at straight time rates for any working day lost, due to transportation delays, or when test pieces must be sent to an outside agency for assessment, except when transportation delays are beyond the control of the Employer.
reasoning: Provides compensation for waiting time caused by delays or outside assessments.

rule_text: Welders, upon successfully completing such tests, who fail to report for work, or fail to commence work when directed, will not be eligible for daily subsistence, travel allowance, transportation, accommodation, waiting, and/or testing time pay.
reasoning: Nullifies all allowances and pay if the worker passes the test but fails to start work.

rule_text: A welder (Journeyman or Apprentice) who is required by the Employer or the Employer's client to perform on any Gas Tungsten Arc Welding (GTAW) test or Gas Metal Arc Welding (GMAW) test or Flux-Core Arc Welding (FCAW) test for pressure welding will be paid a testing fee of one hundred and seventy-five ($175.00) dollars... providing they meet the following criteria
reasoning: Establishes a fixed incentive fee for specific pressure welding tests, contingent on criteria.

rule_text: Welders with a valid alloy welding certificate will be paid an additional premium of $3.25 per hour worked if certification was a requirement for dispatch.
reasoning: Defines an hourly wage premium for alloy welding certification.

rule_text: If a welder on site who was not dispatched as an alloy welder... is requested to perform alloy welding, the worker will be re-classified as an alloy welder and paid the alloy welder premium for all hours worked during the applicable work cycle.
reasoning: Mandates reclassification and premium pay for the full work cycle when performing requested alloy work.

rule_text: All work performed on the following recognized holidays, and any general holiday declared by the level of government with jurisdiction, either the Federal or Provincial, shall be paid for at the rate of double time, plus any applicable shift differential
reasoning: Defines the double time pay rate for working on recognized holidays.

rule_text: | New Years Day (Jan 1) | Labour Day (September) | | Family Day (February) | Nat. Day for Truth &Rec. (Sept 30) | | Good Friday (April) | Thanksgiving Day (October) | | Victoria Day (Monday) | Remembrance Day (Nov 11) | | Canada Day (July1) | Christmas Day (Dec 25) | | Heritage Day (August) | Boxing Day (Dec 26) |
reasoning: Explicit list of days recognized as holidays for the purpose of double time and holiday pay calculations.

rule_text: Each of the general holidays listed in clause 14.01 shall be observed on the calendar date on which it occurs, premiums will apply for hours worked
reasoning: Clarifies that holidays are observed on the actual calendar date rather than moved to adjacent weekdays.

rule_text: No work shall be performed on Labour Day, except for the preservation of life or imminent danger to property.
reasoning: Establishes a prohibition on work for a specific holiday except in emergencies.

rule_text: In lieu of pay for the above recognized holidays the Employer shall pay an additional 4% to the Employee's total hourly earnings each week, including overtime hours and premium time hours.
reasoning: Defines the Holiday Pay accrual rate (4%) and the base it is calculated on (total earnings).

rule_text: Employees annual Vacation Pay shall be 6% of the Employee's total hourly earnings. Such total hourly earnings shall be deemed to include straight time hours, overtime hours, premium time hours and shall be paid each pay period with the Employee's regular pay.
reasoning: Defines the Vacation Pay rate (6%) and the requirement to pay it out weekly on all hours.

rule_text: For the Calgary 496 jurisdiction only, for Commercial/Institutional work only, the Employer shall have the option to pay V.H.P. and S.H.P. with each pay cheque, or as follows:  at the time vacation is taken;  on the last payday prior to December 31st;  on termination.
reasoning: Provides a specific exception for payment timing of vacation/holiday pay for a specific jurisdiction and work type.

rule_text: Whether the Employees receive the above noted holiday and vacation pay each pay period, or whether the vacation and holiday pay are to be retained by the Employer... shall be determined by a majority vote of the Employees of that Employer.
reasoning: Defines the mechanism (employee vote) for determining when holiday/vacation pay is distributed in the specific option scenario.

rule_text: The lunch break will consist of a one-half hour unpaid break taken approximately mid-way during the regular workday.
reasoning: Establishes the standard duration and unpaid status of the daily meal break.

rule_text: If the lunch break is delayed such that it starts more than one-half hour after the completion of the normal lunch break, the Employee will be paid an additional one-half hour at their applicable straight time rate for the one-half hour lunch break.
reasoning: Defines a penalty payment (meal payment) triggered by the delay of the scheduled lunch break.

rule_text: All Employees covered by this agreement shall be permitted ten (10) minutes in the first half and ten (10) minutes in the second half of a shift for a coffee break on the job during regular working hours.
reasoning: Establishes the standard paid rest breaks (coffee breaks) within regular shift hours.

rule_text: If extended overtime is required, additional coffee breaks shall be permitted during such overtime after each two (2) hours following each overtime meal break.
reasoning: Specifies entitlement to additional breaks during extended overtime periods.

rule_text: However, for INDUSTRIAL WORK ONLY and on a compressed work week scheduled pursuant to Article 17.00, Employees shall be permitted a break of fifteen (15) minutes in the first half and fifteen (15) minutes in the second half of such shifts.
reasoning: Modifies the break duration specifically for Industrial Work on compressed schedules.

rule_text: When ten (10) hour shifts are worked, in lieu of the work breaks and lunch breaks provided herein, the Employer shall have the option of scheduling two breaks of one half (½) hour each, paid at the applicable rate, approximately equally spaced in the ten (10) hour shift.
reasoning: Provides an alternative shift and break structure option for employers running 10-hour shifts, changing unpaid lunch to paid breaks.

rule_text: In the event an employee is not able to take a break, the employee shall be paid at applicable overtime rates for the missed break. When the hour before and the hour following the missed break are at straight tine, time and one half (1 ½ x) shall be paid for the missed break.
reasoning: Defines the compensation rate for missed breaks, specifically setting the overtime multiplier.

rule_text: If an employer requests a worker to participate in a POCT risk assessment pursuant to 4.8.5 of the Canadian Model , and the worker provides the urine sample, and the laboratory drug test result is negative, the worker shall be paid for any time the worker would have otherwise worked while waiting for the laboratory result
reasoning: Mandates payment for scheduled hours lost while waiting for drug test confirmation results (conditional on negative result).

rule_text: The maximum of eight (8) hours shall constitute a normal day's work beginning at 8:00 AM and ending by 5:00 PM (except when one-half (½) hour lunch is taken in which case the normal day will end at 4:30 PM). The maximum normal work week shall be forty (40) hours beginning Monday at 8:00 AM and ending Friday at 5:00 PM.
reasoning: Defines the standard billing hours for a normal day and week.

rule_text: Forty (40) hours shall constitute a work week, Monday through Friday. All other time worked shall be considered overtime and shall be paid for at the applicable overtime rate of pay.
reasoning: Establishes the weekly threshold for overtime calculation.

rule_text: The first two (2) hours of overtime per day, Monday through Friday inclusive, shall be paid at one and one half (1½) times the applicable rate of pay.
reasoning: Specifies the 1.5x overtime rate for the first two hours of OT on weekdays.

rule_text: All other overtime hours, Monday through Friday inclusive, shall be paid at two (2) times the applicable rate of pay.
reasoning: Specifies the double time (2x) rate for weekday overtime exceeding two hours.

rule_text: All hours worked on Saturday, Sunday and Statutory Holidays shall be paid at two (2) times the applicable rate of pay.
reasoning: Defines the double time rate for all work performed on weekends and holidays.

rule_text: All hours worked in excess of eight (8) hours per day or forty (40) hours per week will be considered to be overtime hours and will be paid at the rate of one and one-half times the applicable rate of pay except for work on Sundays and Statutory Holidays which will be paid at double time.
reasoning: Specific rule for Commercial/Institutional projects setting OT at 1.5x generally, but maintaining 2x for Sundays/Holidays.

rule_text: When an Employee is required to work prior to the commencement of their regular shift, such time shall be considered as overtime.
reasoning: Classifies pre-shift work specifically as overtime regardless of total hours.

rule_text: The maximum of ten (10) hours shall constitute a normal day's work beginning at 7:00 AM and ending by 6:00 PM (except when one-half (½) hour lunch is taken in which case the normal day will end at 5:30 PM). The maximum normal work week shall be forty (40) hours beginning Monday at 7:00 AM and ending Thursday at 6:00 PM.
reasoning: Defines the standard straight-time hours and window for compressed work weeks.

rule_text: On a four (4) ten (10) schedule, when Friday is worked, the first ten hours shall be paid at one and oneha1f (1½x) times the applicable rate of pay.
reasoning: Specifies the overtime rate for Friday work on a 4x10 schedule.

rule_text: Should an employee work on the scheduled days off, the Friday and Monday will be paid at time and one half (1½x), and the Saturday and Sunday will be paid at double time (2x).
reasoning: Specifies overtime rates for scheduled days off on a 10-on-4-off compressed schedule.

rule_text: Where these options are worked, all hours in excess of ten (10) hours per day Monday through Thursday, shall be paid for at two (2x) times the applicable rate of pay.
reasoning: Establishes double time as the rate for daily overtime on standard compressed work days.

rule_text: Notwithstanding the foregoing, all overtime hours on Commercial/Institutional projects shall be paid for at the rate of time and one-half except for work in Local 488's jurisdiction where work on Sundays and Statutory Holidays shall be paid at double time.
reasoning: Provides specific overtime exceptions for Commercial/Institutional projects.

rule_text: A worker who is preauthorized to take personal time off pursuant to the above procedure, will qualify for overtime premiums for any work performed either preceding or following the normal scheduled hours of work on the day they take their personal absence regardless of whether or not they have worked the full eight or ten hours as scheduled for that shift.
reasoning: Protects overtime entitlement for preauthorized partial day absences.

rule_text: In the case of a compressed work week, overtime premiums will be paid for hours worked in excess of ten in a day or forty in a week.
reasoning: Defines the specific overtime thresholds for compressed work weeks.

rule_text: Workers who are absent from work without pre-authorization, must work the minimum normal hours as stipulated above prior to overtime premiums being paid.
reasoning: Establishes a penalty for unauthorized absences requiring make-up of straight time before overtime applies.

rule_text: Employees who do not commence work shall be paid for two (2) hours at the applicable overtime rate, and any travel and transportation applicable.
reasoning: Defines the minimum payment (2 hours OT) for a call out where the employee reports but does not start work.

rule_text: Employees who are called in and commence work shall be paid for a minimum of three (3) hours at the applicable overtime rate and any travel and transportation applicable.
reasoning: Defines the minimum payment (3 hours OT) for a call out where the employee starts work.

rule_text: Where an Employee works more than the three (3) hours set out in 18.01 (b) above, the Employee shall receive remuneration for the hours actually worked at the applicable overtime rates and any travel or transportation applicable.
reasoning: Clarifies that call outs exceeding the 3-hour minimum are paid for actual time worked at overtime rates.

rule_text: In the event that an Employee, responding to a call out does not get an eight (8) hour break, prior to the commencement of their regular workday, the Employee(s) shall be allowed an eight (8) hour rest break and be paid for a normally scheduled workday.
reasoning: Establishes an entitlement to a paid 8-hour rest break if a call out interrupts the necessary rest period before a regular shift.

rule_text: To qualify for the normally scheduled days pay the Employee shall be available for work at the end of the eight (8) hour break.
reasoning: Sets a condition (must be available for work) to receive the paid rest break/scheduled day pay defined in the previous sentence.

rule_text: Should each of the shifts outlined above not continue for a period of four (4) or five (5) consecutive working days, all hours worked shall be deemed overtime and paid at the applicable rates contained in this Agreement.
reasoning: Defines penalty (deemed overtime) if shift duration requirements are not met

rule_text: Where a shift is commenced and has run for at least the four (4) or five (5) consecutive days referred to above, should the shift terminate in the middle of the week, or an Employee hires on in a week in which a shift ends, affected Employee(s) shall only be entitled to shift premium on regular hours of work.
reasoning: Clarifies entitlement to shift premium for incomplete weeks if the shift cycle itself met the duration requirement

rule_text: By mutual agreement, shifts may be established for periods of less than four (4) or five (5) consecutive regular working days and in such an event, the deemed overtime that would otherwise be payable shall not apply.
reasoning: Exception to the deemed overtime rule for short shifts if agreed upon mutually

rule_text: The first shift shall work a normal shift as set out in Clause 16.01 and/or 17.01 of this Agreement, with the applicable overtime rate after eight (8) hours of work or in excess of ten (10) hours per day during a compressed work week.
reasoning: Defines overtime thresholds specifically for the first shift

rule_text: Shift work other than the normal shift as outlined in Clause 19.03 may be utilized provided such shift(s) commence between 3.00 PM and 6.00 AM.
reasoning: Defines the qualifying start times for alternate/premium shifts

rule_text: The hourly rate for Employees on any alternate shift(s) as outlined above shall be $4.00 per hour effective May 4 th , 2025 ($4.50 effective May 3, 2026) greater than the applicable day time rate of pay.
reasoning: Specifies the monetary value of the shift differential/premium

rule_text: No Employee shall work more than one (1) straight time shift in each consecutive twenty-four (24) hour period.
reasoning: Limits the number of straight time shifts per 24 hours

rule_text: An Employee shall continue to receive the overtime rate, plus shift differential, after each shift until a break of eight (8) consecutive hours occurs, exclusive of travel allowance.
reasoning: Mandates overtime pay continuity if an 8-hour break is not provided

rule_text: When an Employee loses a regular day through the implementation or termination of shift work, then the Employee shall be paid a regular days pay for the day lost.
reasoning: Guarantees pay for days lost due to scheduling changes for shift work

rule_text: Where the owner/client may require work to be done on a single shift basis at start/quit times that may be at variance with the start/quit for a regular shift, single shift operations shall be permitted subject to the payment of shift differential. The shift differential shall be paid on all hours worked.
reasoning: Permits single shift operations but requires shift differential on all hours

rule_text: Overtime shall be payable on all hours in excess of eight (8) hours per day, or in excess of ten (10) hours per day during a compressed work week, and forty (40) hours per week and on Saturdays, Sundays, or Statutory Holidays.
reasoning: Defines specific overtime triggers for the single shift operations described in the preceding paragraph

rule_text: Where Employees are required to work in excess of ten (10) hours in a single shift, they shall be provided immediately after ten (10) hours, with a suitable meal (hot where possible) and every four (4) hours thereafter until the shift is ended.
reasoning: Establishes the entitlement to a physical meal based on shift duration exceeding 10 hours and subsequent 4-hour intervals.

rule_text: The cost of the meal(s) and the time consuming same shall be paid for at the straight time rates contained in this Agreement, to a maximum of one half (½) hour in duration.
reasoning: Defines the compensation for the meal time (paid at straight time) and limits the paid duration to 30 minutes.

rule_text: On projects when it is impractical for the contractor to provide a meal the employee shall be paid a 15-minute paid break at the applicable rate of pay and the employer shall pay a meal allowance of $45.00 in lieu of the meal and the time to consume the meal.
reasoning: Sets a specific monetary allowance ($45) and a paid break entitlement when a physical meal cannot be provided.

rule_text: Where a shift in excess of 10 hours but not longer than 12 hours is worked, when camp accommodations are provided and a full course hot supper is provided at the end of the shift, no meal allowance shall be payable.
reasoning: Creates an exception to the meal allowance rule specifically when camp accommodations and a hot supper are provided for shifts between 10-12 hours.

rule_text: Recognizing emergency or unplanned situations may arise intermittently, if the Contractor has not scheduled in excess of the ten (10) hour shift, the Contractor shall be granted a one (1) hour extension where the Contractor need not supply a hot meal or make payment in lieu of
reasoning: Provides a waiver for the meal obligation during unplanned emergency extensions of up to one hour.

rule_text: if the Contractor has not scheduled in excess of the ten (10) hour shift... a fifteen (15) minute rest break paid at the applicable rate will be taken at the tenth (10 th ) hour.
reasoning: Mandates a paid 15-minute break at the 10th hour specifically during unplanned extensions, distinct from the meal break.

rule_text: Under no circumstance shall any Employee work more than eleven (11) hours without adherence to Clause 20.01.
reasoning: Establishes a hard cap (11 hours) after which the standard meal rules (provision and payment) strictly apply regardless of exceptions.

rule_text: Where a supervisor is required to... start up to one (1) hour earlier... or finish up to one (1) hour later... for the purposes of organizing work or facilitating a transition to another shift, the provisions of 20.01 will not apply unless those provisions are applicable to the rest of the crew.
reasoning: Exempts supervisors from overtime meal entitlements when their extra time is solely for organization/transition (up to 1 hour), unless the crew also qualifies.

rule_text: When an Employee reports to work at the regular starting time and such Employee is not put to work, the Employee so affected shall be entitled to a minimum of two (2) hours pay at the applicable rate of pay.
reasoning: Establishes the minimum pay entitlement (2 hours) for reporting to work when no work is provided.

rule_text: In order to qualify for show up time, Employees must remain on the jobsite unless otherwise directed by the Employer.
reasoning: Defines the condition (remaining on site) required to receive show up time pay.

rule_text: Where the Employee(s) are directed to remain at the jobsite for more than two (2) hours, including wait times for company supplied transportation to leave site, they shall be paid for such time at the applicable rate.
reasoning: Ensures employees are paid for actual time if held on site longer than the 2-hour minimum, including transportation wait times.

rule_text: Employee(s) affected shall be paid daily travel, transportation, subsistence or receive camp accommodation as is applicable.
reasoning: Clarifies that employees receiving show up time are still entitled to their daily subsistence, camp, or travel allowances.

rule_text: An Employee is not entitled to show up time if the Employer notifies the Employee that no work is available at least two (2) hours prior to the commencement of the normal workday.
reasoning: Sets a notification deadline (2 hours prior) that negates the employer's obligation to pay show up time.

rule_text: Employees working on a jobsite where they are accommodated in a camp facility will not be entitled to show up time if they are notified that no work is available, at breakfast time, and notices are posted on the bulletin boards in the camp kitchen.
reasoning: Specific exception for camp residents regarding notification timing and method to negate show up pay liability.

rule_text: When an Employee reporting for work qualifies for show up time such time shall include the regular shift premium when applicable.
reasoning: Mandates that show up time pay must include shift premiums if the employee was scheduled for a premium shift.

rule_text: Local Residents residing within a forty-five (45) km radius of the job site shall not be entitled to receive transportation or vehicle allowance, travel allowance, initial and return travel allowance, room and board, subsistence, camp accommodations, or rotational leave provisions.
reasoning: Excludes specific subsistence and travel entitlements for residents within 45km.

rule_text: Local residents residing between a forty-five (45) km radius and a seventy-five (75) km radius of the job site shall not be entitled to receive initial and return travel allowance, room and board or subsistence, or camp accommodations, or rotational leave provisions
reasoning: Excludes specific subsistence entitlements for residents between 45km and 75km.

rule_text: shall be paid a travel allowance of thirty-three dollars ($33.00) per day worked ($36.00 per day worked effective May 4/09) to cover transportation expenses and travel allowance
reasoning: Specifies monetary travel allowance for residents between 45km and 75km when providing their own transport.

rule_text: if transportation is supplied by the Employer, a daily travel allowance of seventeen dollars ($17.00) ($19.00 per day worked effective May 4/09) will be paid for each day worked.
reasoning: Specifies reduced monetary travel allowance for residents between 45km and 75km when employer transport is used.

rule_text: Where a Camp Kitchen is established, and where all workers generally on the project who are not Local Residents attend at the Camp Kitchen to eat their lunches a Local Resident Employee shall be provided the same noon meal without cost to himself.
reasoning: Provides for a free noon meal for local residents under specific camp conditions.

rule_text: In those instances where bagged lunches are provided to camp residents and hot soup is delivered to the jobsite, local residents shall be entitled to pick up hot soup as well.
reasoning: Entitlement to hot soup for local residents when provided to others.

rule_text: Where a Local Resident Employee is required to work overtime, he shall be entitled to overtime meals in accordance with this Agreement.
reasoning: Confirms eligibility for overtime meals for local residents.

rule_text: The minimum rate of wages for a Foreman shall be $5.50 per hour above the basic UA Journeyman Industrial rates as listed in Article 8.01 of this Agreement.
reasoning: Defines the wage premium for Industrial Foremen over the Journeyman rate.

rule_text: The minimum rate of wages for a General Foreman shall be $7.50 per hour, above the basic UA Journeyman Industrial rates as listed in Article 8.01 of this Agreement.
reasoning: Defines the wage premium for Industrial General Foremen over the Journeyman rate.

rule_text: Foremen and General Foremen who are Industrial Construction Crew Supervisor (ICCS) designated will be paid additional premiums of one ($1.50) dollar and fifty cents per hour.
reasoning: Establishes an additional hourly premium for ICCS designated supervisors in the Industrial sector.

rule_text: In no event shall this hourly rate be greater than the applicable overtime rate plus the ICCS premium
reasoning: Sets a cap or calculation constraint on the hourly rate involving the ICCS premium.

rule_text: The Employer agrees that there shall be two (2) Foremen once there are fourteen (14) Journeymen on the job.
reasoning: Mandates the employment (and thus billing) of a second Foreman based on crew size.

rule_text: On projects requiring a minimum of fifteen (15) Welders; there shall be a Qualified 'A' or 'B' Welder employed as a Welder Foreman when fifteen (15) welders are employed.
reasoning: Mandates the upgrade of a Welder to Welder Foreman based on the number of welders employed.

rule_text: An additional Welder Foreman will be employed when twenty-five (25) welders are employed and one (1) Welder Foreman for every twenty (20) Welders employed thereafter.
reasoning: Mandates additional Welder Foremen based on increasing numbers of welders.

rule_text: The minimum rate of wages for a Foreman shall be $4.00 per hour and the minimum rate of wages for a General Foreman shall be $6.00 per hour, above the basic Journeyman rates as listed in Schedule 8.01 Commercial & Institutional Local 488 of this Agreement.
reasoning: Defines wage premiums for Commercial/Institutional Foremen and General Foremen in Local 488.

rule_text: The minimum rate of wages for a Foreman shall be $3.00 per hour and the minimum rate of wages for a General Foreman shall be $6.00 per hour, above the basic Journeyman rates as listed in Schedule 8.01 Commercial & Institutional Local 496 of this Agreement
reasoning: Defines wage premiums for Commercial/Institutional Foremen and General Foremen in Local 496.

rule_text: Workers shall be paid an allowance for time regularly and routinely in excess of forty five minutes each way, for travel within the applicable free zone. The allowance shall be calculated on the regular straight time base rate of each worker.
reasoning: This rule stipulates payment for travel time (time in excess of 45 mins) calculated at the straight time base rate, fitting LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

rule_text: When the transportation provided by the Employer for the conveyance of Employees is delayed by circumstances that are reasonably within the control of the Employer or the bussing company, the Employees shall be paid for all such time, providing the delay is in excess of 15 minutes, beyond the scheduled arrival time, up to a limit of two (2) hours at the applicable straight time rate.
reasoning: Payment for time spent waiting due to transportation delays falls under LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

rule_text: Employees required to travel out of a city or town to another job after working a shift, and before an eight (8) hour break occurs, shall be paid for all time traveled at the rate of time and one-half the normal rate.
reasoning: Specifies payment rate (1.5x) for travel time outside of normal shift hours/break requirements.

rule_text: If still traveling the following day, the Employee shall be paid the normal rate for time traveled during the regular working day only.
reasoning: Specifies payment for travel time during a regular working day.

rule_text: Should an Employee residing in camp accommodation be requested by the Employer or the client's designated camp management personnel to move to another room or camp, they shall be paid two (2) hours at the applicable straight time rates to carry out the move.
reasoning: Fixed payment of 2 hours straight time for moving accommodation fits LABOR_WORKED_TIME as it compensates for time/effort.

rule_text: reimbursement toward the expense of the Employee's board and lodging, and any goods and services tax paid by the Employee in the purchase of board and lodging, by way of a subsistence allowance in the amount of (See Travel Allowance Memo at www.clra.org) per day
reasoning: Defines the standard daily subsistence allowance for board and lodging.

rule_text: On a project/jobsite located over two hundred and fifty (250) radius kilometers from the geographic centers of either the City of Edmonton or Calgary (as applicable) one additional day's subsistence shall be paid for the use of accommodation for the night following the last day worked, provided that the Employee presents a bona-fide commercial receipt
reasoning: Entitlement to extra subsistence allowance based on distance and overnight stay after work completion.

rule_text: Board and room will be supplied, or the daily expense allowance will be paid for any Statutory Holiday which falls on a scheduled workday other than a first or last day of a scheduled shift provided the Employee reports for work on the workday immediately preceding and following the Statutory Holiday.
reasoning: Entitlement to subsistence (board/room or allowance) on Statutory Holidays.

rule_text: directly pick up the cost of the room and pay a meal allowance to be determined as is set out in this Article
reasoning: Explicitly mentions paying a 'meal allowance' when accommodation costs are high and covered directly.

rule_text: Employees unable to work due to legitimate illness, material shortage, job site conditions, or inclement weather and for whom it is not practical to return to their respective primary Alberta residence (or the Union Hall in the case of non-Alberta residents) shall receive their board and room or daily allowance for those work days they were scheduled to work, during the period such circumstances continue, up to a maximum of three (3) days.
reasoning: Provides for subsistence allowance continuation during forced non-work days (illness, weather, etc.).

rule_text: If an Employee who is being provided with subsistence allowance chooses to leave a jobsite prior to the normal quitting time without receiving consent from their Employer, the Employee will receive a prorated amount of subsistence based upon the number of hours the Employee worked in the workday, compared to the regularly scheduled hours of work for the day.
reasoning: Rule regarding the proration of subsistence allowance for partial days worked without consent.

rule_text: If the project gate is beyond daily commuting distance (beyond 125 km of the city centre of either Calgary or Edmonton) the SPNA for the project shall be in the form attached as Template A.
reasoning: Defines the distance threshold (beyond 125 km) that triggers the use of Template A, which typically corresponds to projects requiring subsistence or camp accommodations.

rule_text: If the project gate is within daily commuting distance (within 125 km of the city centre of either Calgary, or Edmonton or within 45 km of the city centre of Red Deer) the SPNA for the project shall be in the form attached as Template B.
reasoning: Defines the distance thresholds (within 125 km of major cities or 45 km of Red Deer) that trigger the use of Template B, which typically corresponds to projects within daily commuting distance.
